intro: Conchophyllum philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline.
